comment: Do the readings, come to class, and take notes. The lectures were really good, especially for an 8 AM class. To get the most out of the class definitely participate. I wish he taught in my major so I could take more of his classes!

Professor Byrd is probably the best professor I have ever had. He's amazing! He loves what he does and it shows. Had to buy books, but they were not textbooks. Make sure to read and take notes! Tests are very detailed and everything he says is on them. He made learning fun again and I actually enjoyed going to class.

Philosophy can be pretty boring but Professor Byrd doesn't just lecture he asks the class to debate about a given topic. You must read the books to pass! The in class discussions are fun. If you do the study guides you should have no problem with his exams. Attendance is graded as well. He's also very helpful.

Professor Byrd is great! He knows so much about this subject and you can tell he loves teaching. Notes notes notes! Everything he says is always on the tests. The tests are a little bit difficult, but if you listen and understand the material, you'll do fine. Would 100% recommend. Does take attendance. No textbook Just ones from Amazon that are $10

The tests are very detailed. Our first exam was all free response, and only after that did he add multiple choice. I did better on all the free response than I did on any multiple choice! He is very passionate about Philosophy and will answer any questions you have, as long as you ASK. I did not ask for help, and I feel like that's why I got a B.
